alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 1:05PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Scattered snow squalls this afternoon... Brief periods of heavy snow are likely across northern New York and Vermont this afternoon. Affected locations will see rapidly changing weather and road conditions with brief heavy snow and breezy winds. A quick snow accumulation of up to an inch is possible. Be prepared for periods of heavy snow. This could lead to temporary whiteout conditions and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. Briefly snow covered or icy roads are also expected. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions reduce speed and make sure headlights are on. If you must travel, please use caution and allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex
